string-array.name: git_full_list
string-array.item: Sets the name you want attached to your commit transactions
Sets the email you want attached to your commit transactions
Ask mergetool not to keep backup files after merging
Set diffmerge as diff tool for GIT. Diffmerge is a very good tool for diff viewing
Enables helpful colorization of command line output. Its pretty and helpful
Temporarily stores all modified tracked files
Restores the most recently stashed files
Discards the most recently stashed changeset
Initialize a project for GIT version control
Creates a new local repository with the specified name
Downloads a project and its entire version history
Lists all new or modified files to be commited
Snapshots the file in preparation for versioning
Incase previous rebase-merge is not going well, delete all previous related works.
Records file snapshots permanently in version history
Staging stage can be omitted. But a new file will not be added due to -a. We have to add new file manually.
Show what revision and author last modified each line of a file
Shows the files last content change history line by line
Show a browser for the tree of the maint branch. Files selected in the browser can be viewed with the internal blame viewer.
Find by binary search the change that introduced a bug
Cancel the operation and return to the pre-sequence state.
Forget about the current operation in progress.
Apply the changes introduced by some existing commits. Learn More: http://git-scm.com/docs/git-cherry-pick
Lists version history for the current branch
Lists version history for a file, including renames
Force push. f stands for force
This will transfer all of your tags to the remote server that are not already there.
Remove "origin" ssh link. This name will be deleted from local git repository
Shows the url saved as origin
git remote add origin “remote repository link”
origin = a name for remote repository link.
Sets remote URL name as origin
Lists all local branches in the current repository
"i" means interactive. For reordering, squashing and other purpose
Rebase to specific CL, reorder CLs. Then run$ git commit --all --amend --no-edit
Continue previous rebase works. Before doing it please do-> git add .
Allows you to, in a non-interactive way, change the base of a commit, or rebase it.
HEAH~5 -> Start position ->Total 5 commits before from HEAD.
Total number of local commits ahead of remote origin
Switches to the specified branch and updates the working directory
Open Diff tool to view differences
See diff of cached files. Press [Shift + zz] for getting out of terminal
Shows file differences not yet staged
Shows file differences between staging and the last file version
Shows content differences between two branches
git pull = fetch + merge. Fetch and merge to latest CL
Just like merge branch but pulls from ssh link and merges into given branch. Always do a PULL before push in a team.
Use this when you have shared your codes. But you "MUST" revert your CL in Reverse order
Combines the specified branch’s history into the current branch
This commands squashes devel branches all commit into one commit and merges into current branch.
Combines bookmark’s branch into current local branch
Run mergetool to resolve conflicts. Run mergetool to merge.
To add a note to a specific commit
reset = Revert, Rollback. Permanently go back to previous commit. It deletes local commits. Use this if only you have not shared your code
Discards all history and changes back to the specified commit
HEAD - The commit I’m currently sitting on; HEAD^ - The commit’s parent; HEAD^^ - The commit’s grand parent. Dont USE --hard if you want to keep the changes.
Moving the mistakenly committed files back to the staging area from the previous commit
Unstages the file, but preserve its contents
Undoes all commits after [commit], preserving changes locally
Reset the unwanted files in order to leave them out from the commit
Downloads all history from the repository bookmark
Shows info from git. To come out of terminal press [Shift + zz]
Outputs metadata and content changes of the specified commit
Removes the file from version control but preserves the file locally
Deletes the file from the working directory and stages the deletion
Changes the file name and prepares it for commit
create the .gitingnore file. In windows we cant create a file without a name but with extension only. Touch = create new file with file name "something"
Gerrit code review with github repositories.
git checkout [bad-commit]; git commit --amend -v; git rebase --onto HEAD [bad-commit] [checked-out-branch]
